txt.en: 'My wounds are not serious. Let me just get my breath back, and I will be fine.\n\n'You have my thanks, [placeholder]. My dwarves and I are fortunate that you came to Othrikar when you did, and your skill during this battle will not be forgotten!'
'Rune-keeper!'
'If you will give me your arm, I would appreciate its support as we walk back to the centre of the outpost.'
Instance: The Word of a Healer
'We need your help up by the mines! Huldar has been wounded!'
The Dourhand attack has been repelled
A sentry of Othrikar has fallen in battle!
Huldar is standing in the centre of Othrikar.\n\nThe dwarf Huldar is waiting to speak to you.
'I think I see one! That's no dwarf of Othrikar!'
The Dourhands plan to attack Othrikar, and you have been charged with keeping the dwarf-defenders fighting as long as possible.
Huldar has been wounded in battle, and now the Othrikar sentries up by the mines are without their Rune-keeper. You must fill in for Huldar before it is too late.
Huldar is up by the mines of Othrikar.\n\nYou have repelled the attack on Othrikar and should speak now to Huldar.
'[placeholder]! You are to be our Rune-keeper, yes?'
'We are expecting a Dourhand attack at any moment.'
'You must use your mastery of runes and their mysteries to keep my dwarves fighting!'
'Follow me, [placeholder].'
'Help! Hendrevail...over the rooftops!'
'I will be aiding the sentries up there, by the mines.'
'Your position will be over here, [placeholder].'
'Support the guards at the gate ahead! They will have need of your aid!'
Talk to Huldar
Support the Othrikar sentries against the Dourhands
Support the Othrikar sentries at Huldar's position
Talk to Huldar
Avoid losing three Othrikar sentries ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
A great shout arises within the city: hendrevail have flown behind the walls!
'[placeholder]...you will need to protect these dwarves in my stead!'
The Dourhand attack is imminent, and Huldar has asked you to aid in the defence of Othrikar.
'The Dourhands are sure to be here any moment, [placeholder], and we must be ready.\n\n'Come with me, and I will show you to your position.'
